### **About me**

I am an experimental evolutionary ecologist who studies how ecosystem context impacts the ecology and evolution of species interactions. I am interested in quantifying how environmental context (e.g., food web structure, resource quality) modifies species interactions to gain a better understanding of the mechanisms that maintain biodiversity and influence community dynamics.

My research primarily uses use lab-based experiments to quantify species interactions, assay traits, and conduct experimental evolution. I primarily work with aquatic microorganisms, specifically protists and microzooplankton, specializing in continuous culturing methods (i.e., chemostats).
